Package it.unicam.cs.pa.jbudget105101.model

Class LoadBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unicam.cs.pa.jbudget105101.model.Box
      • it.unicam.cs.pa.jbudget105101.model.LoadBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CashBox
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DebitBox, SaveBox
    public abstract class LoadBox
extends Box
    The LoadBox class extends the functionality of a Box allowing you to define a range in which the balance must be included. The purpose of this type of Box is to achieve the set goal. Once achieved, it will no longer be possible to remove or add new transactions, but do not mind, I am sure that you will remain very satisfied in having achieved your goal.
    Version:
    3.5 (06-06-2020)
    Author:
    Damiano Cacchiarelli - damiano.cacchiarelli@studenti.unicam.it

      • getGoal

        public double getGoal()
        Returns:
        the goal of box, if the box supports it

      • addTransaction

        public boolean addTransaction​(Transaction tr)
        This method allows you to add a transaction to the LoadBox. If the loadBox is full, the Transaction cannot be added. In this case, the check method is performed on the transaction in order to prevent the maximum value from being exceeded.
        Specified by:
        addTransaction in interface CashBox
        Overrides:
        addTransaction in class Box
        Parameters:
        tr - a transaction to add
        Returns:
        true if the Transaction has been added; false otherwise.

      • subTransaction

        public boolean subTransaction​(Transaction tr)
        This method allows you to remove a transaction to the LoadBox. If the LoadBox is full, the Transaction cannot be removed.
        Specified by:
        subTransaction in interface CashBox
        Overrides:
        subTransaction in class Box
        Parameters:
        tr - a transaction to remove
        Returns:
        true if the Transaction has been removed; false otherwise.
